intro: Tricalysia delagoensis, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces woody capsules as its fruit. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and parks in warm climates.
